intro: Argocoffeopsis lemblinii, commonly known as the Lemblin's argocoffeopsis, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, woody fruits containing minute seeds. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
